direction.raw_text: An explosion rocks the ship as two robots, Artoo-Detoo (R2-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) and See-Threepio (C-3PO) struggle to make their way through the shaking, bouncing passageway. Both robots are old and battered. Artoo is a short, claw-armed tripod. His face is a mass of computer lights surrounding a radar eye. Threepio, on the other hand, is a tall, slender robot of human proportions. He has a gleaming bronze-like metallic surface of an Art Deco design. Another blast shakes them as they struggle along their way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rebel troopers rush past the robots and take up positions in the main passageway. They aim their weapons toward the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The little R2 unit makes a series of electronic sounds that only another robot could understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo continues making beeping sounds. Tension mounts as loud metallic latches clank and the scream of heavy equipment are heard moving around the outside hull of the ship.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Did you hear that? They've shut down the main reactor. We'll be destroyed for sure. This is madness!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're doomed!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There'll be no escape for the Princess this time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Imperial craft has easily overtaken the Rebel Blockade Runner. The smaller Rebel ship is being drawn into the underside dock of the giant Imperial starship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The nervous Rebel troopers aim their weapons. Suddenly a tremendous blast opens up a hole in the main passageway and a score of fearsome armored spacesuited stormtroopers make their way into the smoke-filled corridor. In a few minutes the entire passageway is ablaze with laserfire. The deadly bolts ricochet in wild random patterns creating huge explosions. Stormtroopers scatter and duck behind storage lockers. Laserbolts hit several Rebel soldiers who scream and stagger through the smoke, holding shattered arms and faces. An explosion hits near the robots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo counters with an angry rebuttal as the battle rages around the two hapless robots.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I should have known better than to trust the logic of a half-sized thermocapsulary dehousing assister...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A death-white wasteland stretches from horizon to horizon. The tremendous heat of two huge twin suns settle on a lone figure, Luke Skywalker, a farm boy with heroic aspirations who looks much younger than his eighteen years. His shaggy hair and baggy tunic give him the air of a simple but lovable lad with a prize-winning smile. A light wind whips at him as he adjusts several valves on a large battered moisture vaporator which sticks out of the desert floor much like an oil pipe with valves. He is aided by a beatup tread-robot with six claw arms. The little robot appears to be barely functioning and moves with jerky motions. A bright sparkle in the morning sky catches Luke's eye and he instinctively grabs a pair of electrobinoculars from his utility belt. He stands transfixed for a few moments studying the heavens, then dashed toward his dented, crudely repaired Landspeeder (an auto-like transport that travels a few feet above the ground on a magnetic-field). He motions for the tiny robot to follow him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The robot scoots around in a tight circle, stops short, and smoke begins to pour out of every joint. Luke throws his arms up in disgust. Exasperated, the young farm boy jumps into his Landspeeder leaving the smoldering robot to hum madly.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hurry up! Come with me! What are you waiting for?! Get in gear!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The awesome, seven-foot-tall Dark Lord of the Sith makes his way into the blinding light of the main passageway. This is Darth Vader, right hand of the Emperor. His face is obscured by his flowing black robes and grotesque breath mask, which stands out next to the fascist white armored suits of the Imperial stormtroopers. Everyone instinctively backs away from the imposing warrior and a deathly quiet sweeps through the Rebel troops. Several of the Rebel troops break and run in a frenzied panic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A woman's hand puts a card into an opening in Artoo's dome. Artoo makes beeping sounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Threepio stands in a hallway, somewhat bewildered. Artoo is nowhere in sight. The pitiful screams of the doomed Rebel soldiers can be heard in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A familiar clanking sound attacks Threepio's attention and he spots little Artoo at the end of the hallway in a smoke- filled alcove. A beautiful young girl (about sixteen years old) stands in front of Artoo. Surreal and out of place, dreamlike and half hidden in the smoke, she finishes adjusting something on Artoo's computer face, then watches as the little robot joins his companion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stormtroopers can be heard battling in the distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo scoots past his bronze friend and races down the subhallway. Threepio chases after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo responds with electronic beeps.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Artoo! Artoo-Detoo, where are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At last! Where have you been?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're heading in this direction. What are we going to do? We'll be sent to the spice mine of Kessel or smashed into who knows what!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait a minute, where are you going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The evil Darth Vader stands amid the broken and twisted bodies of his foes. He grabs a wounded Rebel Officer by the neck as an Imperial Officer rushes up to the Dark Lord.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vader squeezes the neck of the Rebel Officer, who struggles in vain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vader lifts the Rebel off his feet by his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Rebel refuses to speak but eventually cries out as the Dark Lord begins to squeeze the officer's throat, creating a gruesome snapping and choking, until the soldier goes limp. Vader tosses the dead soldier against the wall and turns to his troops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The stormtroopers scurry into the subhallways.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The Death Star plans are not in the main computer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where are those transmissions you intercepted?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What have you done with those plans?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We intercepted no transmissions. Aaah... This is a consular ship. Were on a diplomatic mission.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If this is a consular ship... were is the Ambassador?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Commander, tear this ship apart until you've found those plans and bring me the Ambassador. I want her alive!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The lovely young girl huddles in a small alcove as the stormtroopers search through the ship. She is Princess Leia Organa, a member of the Alderaan Senate. The fear in her eyes slowly gives way to anger as the muted crushing sounds of the approaching stormtroopers grow louder. One of the troopers spots her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leia steps from her hiding place and blasts a trooper with her laser pistol. She starts to run but is felled by a paralyzing ray. The troopers inspect her inert body.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There she is! Set for stun!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She'll be all right. Inform Lord Vader we have a prisoner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Artoo stops before the small hatch of an emergency lifepod. He snaps the seal on the main latch and a red warning light begins to flash. The stubby astro-robot works his way into the cramped four-man pod.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo beeps something to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo whistles something at his reluctant friend regarding the mission he is about to perform.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo isn't happy with Threepio's stubbornness, and he beeps and twangs angrily. A new explosion, this time very close, sends dust and debris through the narrow subhallway. Flames lick at Threepio and, after a flurry of electronic swearing from Artoo, the lanky robot jumps into the lifepod.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, you're not permitted in there. It's restricted. You'll be deactivated for sure..
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't call me a mindless philosopher, you overweight glob of grease! Now come out before somebody sees you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Secret mission? What plans? What are you talking about? I'm not getting in there!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to regret this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: On the main viewscreen, the lifepod carrying the two terrified robots speeds away from the stricken Rebel spacecraft.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There goes another one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hold your fire. There are no life forms. It must have been short- circuited.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Artoo and Threepio look out at the receding Imperial starship. Stars circle as the pod rotates through the galaxy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo beeps an assuring response.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That's funny, the damage doesn't look as bad from out here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you sure this things safe?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Heat waves radiate from the dozen or so bleached white buildings. Luke pilots his Landspeeder through the dusty empty street of the tiny settlement. An old woman runs to get out of the way of the speeding vehicle, shaking her fist at Luke as he flies past.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I've told you kids to slow down!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Luke bursts into the power station, waking The Fixer, a rugged mechanic and Camie, a sexy, disheveled girl who has been asleep in his lap. They grumbled as he races through the office, yelling wildly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke bounces into a small room behind the office where Deak and Windy, two tough boys about the same age as Luke, are playing a computer pool-like game with Biggs, a burly, handsome boy a few years older than the rest. His flashy city attire is a sharp contrast to the loose-fitting tunics of the farm boys. A robot repairs some equipment in the background.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke's surprise at the appearance of Biggs gives way to great joy and emotion. They give each other a great bear hug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Biggs has an air of cool that seems slightly phony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone laughs. The dazzling spectacle of his dashing friend is almost too much for Luke, but suddenly he snaps out of it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Did I hear a young noise blast through here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It was just wormie on another rampage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shape it up you guys!... Biggs?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't know you were back! When did you get in?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just now. I wanted to surprise you, hot shot. I thought you'd be here... certainly didn't expect you to be out working. (he laughs)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Academy didn't change you much...but you're back so soon? Hey, what happened, didn't you get your commission?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course I got it. Signed aboard The Rand Ecliptic last week. First mate Biggs Darklighter at your service... (he salutes) ...I just came to say good-bye to all you unfortunate landlocked simpletons.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I almost forgot. There's a battle going on! Right here in our system. Come and look!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not again! Forget it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The group stumbles out into the stifling desert sun. Camie and The Fixer complain and are forced to shade their eyes. Luke has his binoculars out scanning the heavens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Biggs takes the binoculars from Luke as the others strain to see something with the naked eye. Through the binoculars Biggs sees two small silver specks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Camie grabs the binoculars away banging them against the building in the process. Luke grabs them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Fixer gives Luke a hard look and the young farm boy shrugs his shoulders in resignation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke agrees, although it's obvious he isn't sure why. The group stumbles back into the power station, grumbling about Luke's ineptitude.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There they are!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's no battle, hot shot... they're just sitting there! Probably a freighter-tanker refueling.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But there was a lot of firing earlier...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, easy with those...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry about it, Wormie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I keep telling you, the Rebellion is a long way from here. I doubt if the Empire would even fight to keep this system. Believe me Luke, this planet is a big hunk of nothing...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Princess Leia is led down a low-ceilinged hallway by a squad of armored stormtroopers. Her hands are bound and she is brutally shoved when she is unable to keep up with the briskly marching troops. They stop in a smoky hallway as Darth Vader emerges from the shadows. The sinister Dark Lord stares hard at the frail young senator, but she doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leia is marched away down the hallway and into the smoldering hole blasted in the side of the ship. An Imperial Commander turns to Vader.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another Imperial Officer approaches Vader and the Commander. They stop and snap to attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vader turns to the Commander.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Lord Vader, I should have known. Only you could be so bold. The Imperial Senate will not sit for this, when they hear you've attacked a diplomatic...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't play games with me, Your Highness. You weren't on any mercy mission this time. You passed directly through a restricted system. Several transmissions were beamed to this ship by Rebel spies. I want to know what happened to the plans they sent you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know what you're talking about. I'm a member of the Imperial Senate on a diplomatic mission to Alderaan...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're a part of the Rebel Alliance... and a traitor. Take her away!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Holding her is dangerous. If word of this gets out, it could generate sympathy for the Rebellion in the senate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have traced the Rebel spies to her. Now she is my only link to find their secret base!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She'll die before she tells you anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Leave that to me. Send a distress signal and then inform the senate that all aboard were killed!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Lord Vader, the battle station plans are not aboard this ship! And no transmissions were made. An escape pod was jettisoned during the fighting, but no life forms were aboard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She must have hidden the plans in the escape pod. Send a detachment down to retrieve them. See to it personally, Commander. There'll be no one to stop us this time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Imperial Stardestroyer comes over the surface of the planet Tatooine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jundland, or "No Man's Land", where the rugged desert mesas meet the foreboding dune sea. The two helpless astro-droids kick up clouds of sand as they leave the lifepod and clumsily work their way across the desert wasteland. The lifepod in the distance rests half buried in the sand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo answers with beeping sounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo continues to respond with beeping sounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly Artoo whistles, makes a sharp right turn and starts off in the direction of the rocky desert mesas. Threepio stops and yells at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A stream of electronic noises pours forth from the small robot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo counters with a long whistle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo continues to make beeping sounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo continues to make beeping sounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Threepio gives the little robot a kick and starts off in the direction of the vast dune sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo's reply is a rather rude sound. He turns and trudges off in the direction of the towering mesas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo beeps to himself as he makes his way toward the distant mountains.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How did I get into this mess? I really don't know how. We seem to be made to suffer. It's our lot in life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've got to rest before I fall apart. My joints are almost frozen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What a desolate place this is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where are you going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I'm not going that way. It's much too rocky. This way is much easier.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What makes you think there are settlements over there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't get technical with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What mission? What are you talking about? I've had just about enough of you! Go that way! You'll be malfunctioning within a day, you nearsighted scrap pile!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And don't let me catch you following me begging for help, because you won't get it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No more adventures. I'm not going that way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Threepio, hot and tired, struggles up over the ridge of a dune; only to find more dunes, which seem to go on for endless miles.  He looks back in the direction of the now distant rock mesas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a huff of anger and frustration, Threepio knocks the sand from his joints. His plight seems hopeless, when a glint of reflected light in the distance reveals an object moving towards him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bronze android waves frantically and yells at the approaching transport.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That malfunctioning little twerp. This is all his fault! He tricked me into going this way, but he'll do no better.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait, what's that? A transport! I'm saved!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Over here! Help! Please, help!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Luke and Biggs are walking and drinking a malt brew. Fixer and the others can be heard working inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Biggs looks around then leans close to Luke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke's eyes are wide with Biggs' seriousness and loyalty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke, amazed and stunned, is almost speechless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Biggs shakes his head angrily and then continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Biggs turns away from his old friend and heads towards the power station.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (Very animated) ...so I cut off my power, shut down the afterburners and came in low on Deak's trail. I was so close I thought I was going to fry my instruments. As it was I busted up the Skyhopper pretty bad. Uncle Owen was pretty upset. He grounded me for the rest of the season. You should have been there... it was fantastic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You ought to take it easy Luke. You may be the hottest bushpilot this side of Mos Eisley, but those little Skyhoppers are dangerous. Keep it up, and one day, whammo, you're going to be nothing more than a dark spot on the down side of a canyon wall.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look who's talking. Now that you've been around those giant starships you're beginning to sound like my uncle. You've gotten soft in the city...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've missed you kid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, things haven't been the same since you left, Biggs. It's been so... quiet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Luke, I didn't come back just to say good-bye... I shouldn't tell you this, but you're the only one I can trust... and if I don't come back, I want somebody to know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I made some friends at the Academy. (he whispers) ...when our frigate goes to one of the central systems, we're going to jump ship and join the Alliance...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Join the Rebellion?! Are you kidding! How?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Quiet down will ya! You got a mouth bigger than a meteor crater!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry. I'm quiet. (he whispers) Listen how quiet I am. You can barely hear me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My friend has a friend on Bestine who might help us make contact.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're crazy! You could wander around forever trying to find them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know it's a long shot, but if I don't find them I'll do what I can on my own... It's what we always talked about. Luke, I'm not going to wait for the Empire to draft me into service. The Rebellion is spreading and I want to be on the right side -- the side I believe in.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I'm stuck here...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought you were going to the Academy next term. You'll get your chance to get off this rock.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not likely! I had to cancel my application. There has been a lot of unrest among the Sandpeople since you left... they've even raided the outskirts of Anchorhead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your uncle could hold off a whole colony of Sandpeople with one blaster.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know, but he's got enough vaporators going to make the place pay off. He needs me for just one more season. I can't leave him now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I feel for you, Luke, you're going to have to learn what seems to be important or what really is important. What good is all your uncle's work if it's taken over by the Empire?... You know they're starting to nationalize commerce in the central systems... it won't be long before your uncle is merely a tenant, slaving for the greater glory of the Empire.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It couldn't happen here. You said it yourself. The Empire won't bother with this rock.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Things always change.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wish I was going... Are you going to be around long?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I'm leaving in the morning...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then I guess I won't see you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe someday... I'll keep a lookout.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I'll be at the Academy next season... after that who knows. I won't be drafted into the Imperial Starfleet that's for sure... Take care of yourself, you'll always be the best friend I've got.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So long, Luke.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The gargantuan rock formations are shrouded in a strange foreboding mist and the onimous sounds of unearthly creatures fill the air. Artoo moves cautiously through the creepy rock canyon, inadvertently making a loud clicking noise as he goes. He hears a distant, hard, metallic sound and stops for a moment. Convinced he is alone, he continues on his way. In the distance, a pebble tumbles down the steep canyon wall and a small dark figure darts into the shadows. A little further up the canyon a slight flicker of light reveals a pair of eyes in the dark recesses only a few feet from the narrow path. The unsuspecting robot waddles along the rugged trail until suddenly, out of nowhere, a powerful magnetic ray shoots out of the rocks and engulfs him in an eerie glow. He manages one short electronic squeak before he topples over onto his back. His bright computer lights flicker off, then on, then off again. Out of the rocks scurry three Jawas, no taller than Artoo. They holster strange and complex weapons as they cautiously approach the robot. They wear grubby cloaks and their faces are shrouded so only their glowing eyes can be seen. They hiss and make odd guttural sounds as they heave the heavy robot onto their shoulders and carry him off down the trail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The eight Jawas carry Artoo out of the canyon to a huge tank- like vehicle the size of a four-story house. They weld a small disk on the side of Artoo and then put him under a large tube on the side of the vehicle and the little robot is sucked into the giant machine. The filthy little Jawas scurry like rats up small ladders and enter the main cabin of the behemoth transport.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is dim inside the hold area of the Sandcrawler. Artoo switches on a small floodlight on his forehead and stumbles around the scrap heap. The narrow beam swings across rusty metal rocket parts and an array of grotesquely twisted and maimed astro-robots. He lets out a pathetic electronic whimper and stumbles off toward what appears to be a door at the end of the chamber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo enters a wide room with a four-foot ceiling. In the middle of the scrap heap sit a dozen or so robots of various shapes and sizes. Some are engaged in electronic conversation, while others simply mill about. A voice of recognition calls out from the gloom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A battered Threepio scrambles up to Artoo and embraces him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Artoo-Detoo! It's you! It's you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The enormous Sandcrawler lumbers off toward the magnificent twin suns, which are slowly setting over a distant mountain ridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four Imperial stormtroopers mill about in front of the half- buried lifepod that brought Artoo and Threepio to Tatooine. A trooper yells to an officer some distance away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A second trooper picks a small bit of metal out of the sand and gives it to the first trooper.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Someone was in the pod. The tracks go off in this direction.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, sir -- droids.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Sandcrawler moves slowly down a great sand dune.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Threepio and Artoo noisily bounce along inside the cramped prison chamber. Artoo appears to be shut off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly the shaking and bouncing of the Sandcrawler stops, creating quite a commotion among the mechanical men. Threepio's fist bangs the head of Artoo whose computer lights pop on as he begins beeping. At the far end of the long chamber a hatch opens, filling the chamber with blinding white light. a dozen or so Jawas make their way through the odd assortment of robots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A Jawa starts moving toward them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo responds, making beeping sounds.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Wake up! Wake up!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We're doomed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you think they'll melt us down?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't shoot! Don't shoot! Will this never end?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Jawas mutter gibberish as they busily line up their battered captives, including Artoo and Threepio, in front of the enormous Sandcrawler, which is parked beside a small homestead consisting of three large holes in the ground surrounded by several tall moisture vaporators and one small adobe block house. The Jawas scurry around fussing over the robots, straightening them up or brushing some dust from a dented metallic elbow. The shrouded little creatures smell horribly, attracting small insects to the dark areas when their mouths and nostrils should be. Out of the shadows of a dingy side-building limps Owen Lars, a large burly man in his mid-fifties. His reddish eyes are sunken in a dust-covered face. As the farmer carefully inspects each robot, he is closely followed by his slump- shouldered nephew, Luke Skywalker. One of the vile little Jawas walks ahead of the farmer spouting an animated sales pitch in a queer, unintelligible language. A voice calls out from one of the huge holes that form the homestead. Luke goes over to the edge and sees his Aunt Beru standing in the main courtyard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke returns to his uncle as they look over the equipment for sale with the Jawa leader.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the Jawas start to lead the three remaining robots back into the Sandcrawler, Artoo lets out a pathetic little beep and starts after his old friend Threepio. He is restrained by a slimy Jawa, who zaps him with a control box. Owen is negotiating with the head Jawa. Luke and the two robots start off for the garage when a plate pops off the head of the red astro-droid's head plate and it sparks wildly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Jawa goes into a loud spiel. Meanwhile, Artoo has sneaked out of line and is moving up and down trying to attract attention. He lets out with a low whistle. Threepio taps Luke on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With a little reluctance the scruffy dwarf trades the damaged astro-droid for Artoo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Owen pays off the whining Jawa as Luke and the two robots trudge off toward a grimy homestead entry.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Luke, tell Owen that if he gets a translator to be sure it speaks Bocce.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It looks like we don't have much of a choice but I'll remind him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have no need for a protocol droid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quickly) Sir -- not in an environment such as this -- that's why I've also been programmed for over thirty secondary functions that...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What I really need is a droid that understands the binary language of moisture vaporators.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Vaporators! Sir -- My first job was programming binary load lifter... very similar to your vaporators. You could say...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you speak Bocce?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Of course I can, sir. It's like a second language for me... I'm as fluent in Bocce...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right shut up! (turning to Jawa) I'll take this one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shutting up, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Luke, take these two over to the garage, will you? I want you to have both of them cleaned up before dinner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I was going into Toshi Station to pick up some power converters...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can waste time with your friends when your chores are done. Now come on, get to it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, come on! And the red one, come on. Well, come on, Red, let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uncle Owen...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This R2 unit has a bad motivator. Look!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to the head Jawa) Hey, what're you trying to push on us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing to Artoo) Excuse me, sir, but that R2 unit is in prime condition. A real bargain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uncle Owen...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about that one?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Jawa) What about that blue one? We'll take that one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, take it away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, I'm quite sure you'll be very pleased with that one, sir. He really is in first-class condition. I've worked with him before. Here he comes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, let's go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Artoo) Now, don't you forget this! Why I should stick my neck out for you is quite beyond my capacity!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The garage is cluttered and worn, but a friendly peaceful atmosphere permeates the low grey chamber. Threepio lowers himself into a large tub filled with warm oil. Near the battered Landspeeder little Artoo rests on a large battery with a cord to his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo beeps a muffled reply. Luke seems to be lost in thought as he runs his hand over the damaged fin of a small two-man Skyhopper spaceship resting in a low hangar off the garage. Finally Luke's frustrations get the better of him and he slams a wrench across the workbench.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke glances at the battered robot. A bit of his anger drains and a tiny smile creeps across his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo beeps in response. Luke unplugs Artoo and begins to scrape several connectors on the robot's head with a chrome pick. Threepio climbs out of the oil tub and begins wiping oil from his bronze body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke struggles to remove a small metal fragment from Artoo's neck joint. He uses a larger pick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fragment breaks loose with a snap, sending Luke tumbling head over heels. He sits up and sees a twelve-inch three- dimensional hologram of Leia Organa, the Rebel senator, being projected from the face of little Artoo. The image is a rainbow of colors as it flickers and jiggles in the dimly lit garage. Luke's mouth hangs open in awe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo looks around and sheepishly beeps an answer for Threepio to translate. Leia continues to repeat the sentence fragment over and over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo whistles his surprise as he pretends to just notice the hologram. He looks around and sheepishly beeps an answer for Threepio to translate. Leia continues to repeat the sentence fragment over and over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke becomes intrigued by the beautiful girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke reaches out for Artoo but he lets out several frantic squeaks and a whistle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo whistles and beeps a long message to Threepio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke's gazes at the beautiful young princess for a few moments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo beeps something to Threepio.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke looks longingly at the lovely, little princess and hasn't really heard what Threepio has been saying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke takes a wedged bar and pops the restraining bolt off Artoo's side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The princess immediately disappears...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo beeps an innocent reply as Threepio sits up in embarrassment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A women's voice calls out from another room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke stands up and shakes his head at the malfunctioning robot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke tosses Artoo's restraining bolt on the workbench and hurries out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo beeps in response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo beeps.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Thank the maker! This oil bath is going to feel so good. I've got such a bad case of dust contamination, I can barely move!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It just isn't fair. Oh, Biggs is right. I'm never gonna get out of here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is there anything I might do to help?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, not unless you can alter time, speed up the harvest, or teleport me off this rock!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think so, sir. I'm only a droid and not very knowledgeable about such things. Not on this planet, anyways. As a matter of fact, I'm not even sure which planet I'm on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, if there's a bright center to the universe, you're on the planet that it's farthest from.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I see, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, you can call me Luke.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I see, sir Luke.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughing) Just Luke.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I am See-Threepio, human-cyborg relations, and this is my counterpart, Artoo-Detoo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hello.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got a lot of carbon scoring here. It looks like you boys have seen a lot of action.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: With all we've been through, sometimes I'm amazed we're in as good condition as we are, what with the Rebellion and all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know of the Rebellion against the Empire?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's how we came to be in your service, if you take my meaning, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Have you been in many battles?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Several, I think. Actually, there's not much to tell. I'm not much more than an interpreter, and not very good at telling stories. Well, not at making them interesting, anyways.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, my little friend, you've got something jammed in here real good. Were you on a cruiser or...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi. You're my only hope.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is what?!? He asked you a question... (pointing to Leia) What is that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi. You're my only hope. Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi. You're my only hope.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, he says it's nothing, sir. Merely a malfunction. Old data. Pay it no mind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who is she? She's beautiful.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm afraid I'm not quite sure, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think she was a passenger on our last voyage. A person of some importance, sir -- I believe. Our captain was attached to...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is there more to this recording?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Behave yourself, Artoo. You're going to get us in trouble. It's all right, you can trust him. He's our new master.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He says he's the property of Obi-Wan Kenobi, a resident of these parts. And it's a private message for him. Quite frankly, sir I don't know what he's talking about. Our last master was Captain Antilles, but with what we've been through, this little R2 unit has become a bit eccentric.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Obi-Wan Kenobi? I wonder if he means old Ben Kenobi?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I beg your pardon, sir, but do you know what he's talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I don't know anyone named Obi- Wan, but old Ben lives out beyond the dune sea. He's kind of a strange old hermit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wonder who she is. It sounds like she's in trouble. I'd better play back the whole thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He says the restraining bolt has short circuited his recording system. He suggests that if you remove the bolt, he might be able to play back the entire recording.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: H'm? Oh, yeah, well, I guess you're too small to run away on me if I take this off! Okay.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There you go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, wait a minute. Where'd she go? Bring her back! Play back the entire message.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What message? The one you're carrying inside your rusty innards!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Luke? Luke! Come to dinner!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, I'll be right there, Aunt Beru.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry, sir, but he appears to have picked up a slight flutter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, see what you can do with him. I'll be right back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Artoo) Just you reconsider playing that message for him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I don't think he likes you at all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, I don't like you either.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Luke's Aunt Beru, a warm, motherly woman, fills a pitcher with blue fluid from a refrigerated container in the well- used kitchen. She puts the pitcher on a tray with some bowls of food and starts for the dining area. Luke sits with his Uncle Owen before a table covered with steaming bowls of food as Aunt Beru carries in a bowl of red grain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Owen is greatly alarmed at the mention of his name, but manages to control himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Owen breaks loose with a fit of uncontrolled anger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Owen's face becomes a scowl, although he tries to suppress it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke continues to toy with his food, not looking at his uncle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke pushes his half-eaten plate of food aside and stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Resigned to his fate, Luke paddles out of the room. Owen mechanically finishes his dinner.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You know, I think that R2 unit we bought might have been stolen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What makes you think that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I stumbled across a recording while I was cleaning him. He says he belongs to someone called Obi-Wan Kenobi.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I thought he might have meant old Ben. Do you know what he's talking about? Well, I wonder if he's related to Ben.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That old man's just a crazy old wizard. Tomorrow I want you to take that R2 unit into Anchorhead and have its memory flushed. That'll be the end of it. It belongs to us now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But what if this Obi-Wan comes looking for him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He won't, I don't think he exists any more. He died about the same time as your father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He knew my father?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told you to forget it. Your only concern is to prepare the new droids for tomorrow. In the morning I want them on the south ridge working out those condensers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir. I think those new droids are going to work out fine. In fact, I, uh, was also thinking about our agreement about my staying on another season. And if these new droids do work out, I want to transmit my application to the Academy this year.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mean the next semester before harvest?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure, there're more than enough droids.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Harvest is when I need you the most. Only one more season. This year we'll make enough on the harvest so I'll be able to hire some more hands. And then you can go to the Academy next year.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You must understand I need you here, Luke.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But it's a whole 'nother year.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, it's only one more season.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, that's what you said last year when Biggs and Tank left.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where are you going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It looks like I'm going nowhere. I have to finish cleaning those droids.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Owen, he can't stay here forever. Most of his friends have gone. It means so much to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll make it up to him next year. I promise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Luke's just not a farmer, Owen. He has too much of his father in him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what I'm afraid of.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The giant twin suns of Tatooine slowly disappear behind a distant dune range. Luke stands watching them for a few moments, then reluctantly enters the doomed entrance to the homestead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke enters the garage to discover the robots nowhere in sight. He takes a small control box from his utility belt similar to the one the Jawas were carrying. He activates the box, which creates a low hum, and Threepio, letting out a short yell, pops up from behind the Skyhopper spaceship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Threepio stumbles forward, but Artoo is still nowhere in sight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke races out of the garage followed by Threepio.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doing hiding there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It wasn't my fault, sir. Please don't deactivate me. I told him not to go, but he's faulty, malfunctioning; kept babbling on about his mission.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, no!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Luke rushes out of the small doomed entry to the homestead and searches the darkening horizon for the small triped astro- robot. Threepio struggles out of the homestead and on the salt flat as Luke scans the landscape with his electrobinoculars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Owen yells up from the homestead plaza.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes one final look across the dim horizon.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: That R2 unit has always been a problem. These astro-droids are getting quite out of hand. Even I can't understand their logic at times.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How could I be so stupid? He's nowhere in sight. Blast it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pardon me, sir, but couldn't we go after him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's too dangerous with all the Sandpeople around. We'll have to wait until morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Luke, I'm shutting the power down for the night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, I'll be there in a few minutes. Boy, am I gonna get it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know that little droid is going to cause me a lot of trouble.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, he excels at that, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Morning slowly creeps into the sparse but sparkling oasis of the open courtyard. The idyll is broken be the yelling of Uncle Owen, his voice echoing throughout the homestead.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Luke? Luke? Luke? Where could he be loafing now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The interior of the kitchen is a worm glow as Aunt Beru prepares the morning breakfast. Owen enters in a huff.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Have you seen Luke this morning?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He said he had some things to do before he started today, so he left early.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh? Did he take those two new droids with him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, he'd better have those units in the south range repaired be midday or there'll be hell to pay!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The rock and sand of the desert floor are a blur as Threepio pilots the sleek Landspeeder gracefully across the vast wasteland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke leans over the back of the speeder and adjusts something in the motor compartment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Threepio signals that is fine and Luke turns back into the wind-whipped cockpit and pops the canopy shut.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (yelling) How's that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Old Ben Kenobi lives out in this direction somewhere, but I don't see how that R2 unit could have come this far. We must have missed him. Uncle Owen isn't going to take this very well.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, would it help if you told him it was my fault.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (brightening) Sure. He needs you. He'd probably only deactivate you for a day or so...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Deactivate! Well, on the other hand if you hadn't removed his restraining bolt...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait, there's something dead ahead on the scanner. It looks like our droid... hit the accelerator.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: From high on a rock mesa, the tiny Landspeeder can be seen gliding across the desert floor. Suddenly in the foreground two weather-beaten Sandpeople shrouded in their grimy desert cloaks peer over the edge of the rock mesa. One of the marginally human creatures raises a long ominous laser rifle and points it at the speeder but the second creature grabs the gun before it can be fired. The Sandpeople, or Tusken Raiders as they're sometimes called, speak in a coarse barbaric language as they get into an animated argument. The second Tusken Raider seems to get in the final word and the nomads scurry over the rocky terrain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Tusken Raider approaches two large Banthas standing tied to a rock. The monstrous, bear-like creatures are as large as elephants, with huge red eyes, tremendous looped horns, and long, furry, dinosaur-like tails. The Tusken Raiders mount saddles strapped to the huge creatures' shaggy backs and ride off down the rugged bluff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The speeder is parked on the floor of a massive canyon. Luke, with his long laser rifle slung over his shoulder, stands before little Artoo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The little droid whistles a feeble reply, as Threepio poses menacingly behind the little runaway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly the little robot jumps to life with a mass of frantic whistles and screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke swings his rifle into position and looks to the south.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, whoa, just where do you think you're going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Master Luke here is your rightful owner. We'll have no more of this Obi-Wan Kenobi jibberish... and don't talk to me about your mission, either. You're fortunate he doesn't blast you into a million pieces right here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, come on. It's getting late. I only hope we can get back before Uncle Owen really blows up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you don't mind my saying so, sir, I think you should deactivate the little fugitive until you've gotten him back to your workshop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, he's not going to try anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's wrong with him now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh my... sir, he says there are several creatures approaching from the southeast.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sandpeople! Or worst! Come on, let's have a look. Come on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Luke carefully makes his way to the top of a rock ridge and scans the canyon with his electrobinoculars. He spots the two riderless Banthas. Threepio struggles up behind the young adventurer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke watches the distant Tusken Raider through his electrobinoculars. Suddenly something huge moves in front of his field of view. Before Luke or Threepio can react, a large, gruesome Tusken Raider looms over them. Threepio is startled and backs away, right off the side if the cliff. He can be heard for several moments as he clangs, bangs and rattles down the side of the mountain. The towering creature brings down his curved, double-pointed gaderffii -- the dreaded axe blade that has struck terror in the heart of the local settlers. But Luke manages to block the blow with his laser rifle, which is smashed to pieces. The terrified farm boy scrambles backward until he is forced to the edge of a deep crevice. The sinister Raider stands over him with his weapon raised and lets out a horrible shrieking laugh.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There are two Banthas down there but I don't see any... wait a second, they're Sandpeople all right. I can see one of them now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Artoo forces himself into the shadows of a small alcove in the rocks as the vicious Sandpeople walk past carrying the inert Luke Skywalker, who is dropped in a heap before the speeder.  The Sandpeople ransack the speeder, throwing parts and supplies in all directions. Suddenly they stop. Then everything is quiet for a few moments. A great howling moan is heard echoing throughout the canyon which sends the Sandpeople fleeing in terror. Artoo moves even tighter into the shadows as the slight swishing sound that frightened off the Sandpeople grows even closer, until a shabby old desert-rat-of-a-man appears and leans over Luke. His ancient leathery face, cracked and weathered by exotic climates is set off by dark, penetrating eyes and a scraggly white beard. Ben Kenobi squints his eyes as he scrutinizes the unconscious farm boy. Artoo makes a slight sound and Ben turns and looks right at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo waddles over to were Luke lies crumpled in a heap and begins to whistle and beep his concern. Ben puts his hand on Luke's forehead and he begins to come around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben ponders this for a moment, scratching his scruffy beard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He suddenly looks up at the overhanging cliffs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke sits up and rubs his head. Artoo lets out a pathetic beep causing Luke to remember something. He looks around.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello there! Come here my little friend. Don't be afraid.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't worry, he'll be all right.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What happened?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rest easy, son, you've had a busy day. You're fortunate you're still in one piece.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ben? Ben Kenobi! Boy, am I glad to see you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Jundland wastes are not to be traveled lightly. Tell me young Luke, what brings you out this far?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, this little droid! I think he's searching for his former master... I've never seen such devotion in a droid before... there seems to be no stopping him. He claims to be the property of an Obi-Wan Kenobi. Is he a relative of yours? Do you know who he's talking about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Obi-Wan Kenobi... Obi-Wan? Now thats a name I haven't heard in a long time... a long time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think my uncle knew him. He said he was dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, he's not dead, not... not yet.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You know him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well of course, of course I know him. He's me! I haven't gone by the name Obi-Wan since oh, before you were born.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then the droid does belong to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't seem to remember ever owning a droid. Very interesting...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think we better get indoors. The Sandpeople are easily startled but they will soon be back and in greater numbers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Threepio!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Little Artoo stands at the edge of a large sand pit and begins to chatter away in electronic whistles and beeps. Luke and Ben stand over a very dented and tangled Threepio lying half buried in the sand. One of his arms has broken off. Luke tries to revive the inert robot by shaking him and then flips a hidden switch on his back several times until finally the mechanical man's systems turn on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo makes a beeping sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke and Ben help the battered robot to his feet. Little Artoo watches from the top of the pit. Ben glances around suspiciously. Sensing something, he stands up and sniffs the air.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where am I? I must have taken a bad step...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Can you stand? We've got to get out of here before the Sandpeople return.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't think I can make it. You go on, Master Luke. There's no sense in you risking yourself on my account. I'm done for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, you're not. What kind of talk is that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Quickly, son... they're on the move.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The small, spartan hovel is cluttered with desert junk but still manages to radiate an air of time-worn comfort and security. Luke is in one corner repairing Threepio's arm, as old Ben sits thinking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben gets up and goes to a chest where he rummages around. As Luke finishes repairing Threepio and starts to fit the restraining bolt back on, Threepio looks at him nervously. Luke thinks about the bolt for a moment then puts it on the table. Ben shuffles up and presents Luke with a short handle with several electronic gadgets attached to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben hands Luke the saber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke pushes a button on the handle. A long beam shoots out about four feet and flickers there. The light plays across the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke hasn't really been listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Artoo makes beeping sounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke is cut short as the recorded image of the beautiful young Rebel princess is projected from Artoo's face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke stops his work as the lovely girl's image flickers before his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a little static and the transmission is cut short. Old Ben leans back and scratches his head. He silently puffs on a tarnished chrome water pipe. Luke has stars in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No, my father didn't fight in the wars. He was a navigator on a spice freighter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what your uncle told you. He didn't hold with your father's ideals. Thought he should have stayed here and not gotten involved.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You fought in the Clone Wars?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, I was once a Jedi Knight the same as your father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wish I'd known him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He was the best star-pilot in the galaxy, and a cunning warrior. I understand you've become quite a good pilot yourself. And he was a good friend. Which reminds me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I have something here for you. Your father wanted you to have this when you were old enough, but your uncle wouldn't allow it. He feared you might follow old Obi-Wan on some damned-fool idealistic crusade like your father did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sir, if you'll not be needing me, I'll close down for awhile.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure, go ahead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your fathers lightsaber. This is the weapon of a Jedi Knight. Not as clumsy or as random as a blaster.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: An elegant weapon for a more civilized time. For over a thousand generations the Jedi Knights were the guardians of peace and justice in the Old Republic. Before the dark times, before the Empire.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How did my father die?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A young Jedi named Darth Vader, who was a pupil of mine until he turned to evil, helped the Empire hunt down and destroy the Jedi Knights. He betrayed and murdered your father. Now the Jedi are all but extinct. Vader was seduced by the dark side of the Force.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Force?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, the Force is what gives a Jedi his power. It's an energy field created by all living things. It surrounds us and penetrates us. It binds the galaxy together.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now, let's see if we can't figure out what you are, my little friend. And where you come from.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I saw part of the message he was...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I seem to have found it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: General Kenobi, years ago you served my father in the Clone Wars. Now he begs you to help him in his struggle against the Empire. I regret that I am unable to present my father's request to you in person, but my ship has fallen under attack and I'm afraid my mission to bring you to Alderaan has failed. I have placed information vital to the survival of the Rebellion into the memory systems of this R2 unit. My father will know how to retrieve it. You must see this droid safely delivered to him on Alderaan. This is our most desperate hour. Help me, Obi-Wan Kenobi, you're my only hope.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You must learn the ways of the Force if you're to come with me to Alderaan.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (laughing) Alderaan? I'm not going to Alderaan. I've got to go home. It's late, I'm in for it as it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need your help, Luke. She needs your help. I'm getting too old for this sort of thing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can't get involved! I've got work to do! It's not that I like the Empire. I hate it! But there's nothing I can do about it right now. It's such a long way from here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's your uncle talking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sighing) Oh, God, my uncle. How am I ever going to explain this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Learn about the Force, Luke.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, I can take you as far as Anchorhead. You can get a transport there to Mos Eisley or wherever you're going.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You must do what you feel is right, of course.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . An Imperial Stardestroyer heads toward the evil planet-like battle station: the Death Star!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eight Imperial senators and generals sit around a black conference table. Imperial stormtroopers stand guard around the room. Commander Tagge, a young, slimy-looking general, is speaking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bitter Admiral Motti twists nervously in his chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly all heads turn as Commander Tagge's speech is cut short and the Grand Moff Tarkin, governor of the Imperial outland regions, enters. He is followed by his powerful ally, The Sith Lord, Darth Vader. All of the generals stand and bow before the thin, evil-looking governor as he takes his place at the head of the table. The Dark Lord stands behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly Motti chokes and starts to turn blue under Vader's spell.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Until this battle station is fully operational we are vulnerable. The Rebel Alliance is too well equipped. They're more dangerous than you realize.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dangerous to your starfleet, Commander, not to this battle station!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Rebellion will continue to gain a support in the Imperial Senate as long as....
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Imperial Senate will no longer be of any concern to us. I've just received word that the Emperor has dissolved the council permanently. The last remnants of the Old Republic have been swept away.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's impossible! How will the Emperor maintain control without the bureaucracy?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The regional governors now have direct control over territories. Fear will keep the local systems in line. Fear of this battle station.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And what of the Rebellion? If the Rebels have obtained a complete technical readout of this station, it is possible, however unlikely, that they might find a weakness and exploit it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The plans you refer to will soon be back in our hands.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Any attack made by the Rebels against this station would be a useless gesture, no matter what technical data they've obtained. This station is now the ultimate power in the universe. I suggest we use it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be too proud of this technological terror you've constructed. The ability to destroy a planet is insignificant next to the power of the Force.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't try to frighten us with your sorcerer's ways, Lord Vader. Your sad devotion to that ancient religion has not helped you conjure up the stolen data tapes, or given you clairvoyance enough to find the Rebel's hidden fort...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I find your lack of faith disturbing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Enough of this! Vader, release him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As you wish.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This bickering is pointless. Lord Vader will provide us with the location of the Rebel fortress by the time this station is operational. We will then crush the Rebellion with one swift stroke.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The speeder stops before what remains of the huge Jawas Sandcrawler. Luke and Ben walk among the smoldering rubble and scattered bodies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben is crouching in the sand studying the tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke looks back at the speeder where Artoo and Threepio are inspecting the dead Jawas, and put two and two together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke reaches a sudden horrible realization, then races for the speeder and jumps it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke races off leaving Ben and the two robots alone with the burning Sandcrawler.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It looks like Sandpeople did this, all right. Look, here are Gaffi sticks, Bantha tracks. It's just... I never heard of them hitting anything this big before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They didn't. But we are meant to think they did. These tracks are side by side. Sandpeople always ride single file to hide there numbers.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: These are the same Jawas that sold us Artoo and Threepio.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And these blast points, too accurate for Sandpeople. Only Imperial stormtroopers are so precise.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why would Imperial troops want to slaughter Jawas?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If they traced the robots here, they may have learned who they sold them to. And that would lead them home!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wait, Luke! It's too dangerous.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Luke races across the wasteland in his battered Landspeeder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The speeder roars up to the burning homestead. Luke jumps out and runs to the smoking holes that were once his home. Debris is scattered everywhere and it looks as if a great battle has taken place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke stumbles around in a daze looking for his aunt and uncle. Suddenly he comes upon their smoldering remains. He is stunned, and cannot speak. Hate replaces fear and a new resolve comes over him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Uncle Owen! Aunt Beru! Uncle Owen!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Imperial TIE fighter races toward the Death Star.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two stormtroopers open an electronic cell door and allow several Imperial guards to enter. Princess Leia's face is filled with defiance, which slowly gives way to fear as a giant black torture robot enters, followed by Darth Vader.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The torture robot gives off a steady beeping sound as it approaches Princess Leia and extends one of its mechanical arms bearing a large hypodermic needle. The door slides shut and the long cell block hallway appears peaceful. The muffled screams of the Rebel princess are barely heard.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: And, now Your Highness, we will discuss the location of your hidden Rebel base.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: There is a large bonfire of Jawa bodies blazing in front of the Sandcrawler as Ben and the robots finish burning the dead.  Luke drives up in the speeder and Ben walks over to him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: There's nothing you could have done, Luke, had you been there. You'd have been killed, too, and the droids would be in the hands of the Empire.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I want to come with you to Alderaan. There's nothing here for me now. I want to learn the ways of the Force and become a Jedi like my father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Landspeeder with Luke, Artoo, Threepio, and Ben in it zooms across the desert. The speeder stops on a bluff overlooking the spaceport at Mos Eisley. It is a haphazard array of low, grey, concrete structures and semi-domes. A harsh gale blows across the stark canyon floor. Luke adjusts his goggles and walks to the edge of the craggy bluff where Ben is standing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben looks over at Luke, who gives the old Jedi a determined smile.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Mos Eisley Spaceport. You will never find a more wretched hive of scum and villainy. We must be cautious.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The speeder is stopped on a crowded street by several combat- hardend stormtroopers who look over the two robots. A Trooper questions Luke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke becomes very nervous as he fumbles to find his ID while Ben speaks to the Trooper in a very controlled voice.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How long have you had these droids?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: About three or four seasons.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They're for sale if you want them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let me see your identification.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't need to see his identification.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We don't need to see his identification.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: These are not the droids your looking for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: These are not the droids we're looking for.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He can go about his business.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can go about your business.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Luke) Move along.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Move along. Move along.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The speeder pulls up in front of a rundown blockhouse cantina on the outskirts of the spaceport. Various strange forms of transport, including several unusual beasts of burden, are parked outside the bar. A Jawa runs up and begins to fondle the speeder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Luke gets out of the speeder he tries to shoo the Jawa away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I can't abide these Jawas. Disgusting creatures.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go on, go on. I can't understand how we got by those troopers. I thought we were dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Force can have a strong influence on the weak-minded. You will find it a powerful ally.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you really think we're going to find a pilot here that'll take us to Alderaan?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, most of the best freighter pilots can be found here. Only watch your step. This place can be a little rough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm ready for anything.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Come along, Artoo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The young adventurer and his two mechanical servants follow Ben Kenobi into the smoke-filled cantina. The murky, moldy den is filled with a startling array of weird and exotic alien creatures and monsters at the long metallic bar. At first the sight is horrifying. One-eyed, thousand-eyed, slimy, furry, scaly, tentacled, and clawed creatures huddle over drinks. Ben moves to an empty spot at the bar near a group of repulsive but human scum. A huge, rough-looking Bartender stops Luke and the robots.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke still recovering from the shock of seeing so many outlandish creatures, doesn't quite catch the bartender's drift.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Luke looks at old Ben, who is busy talking to one of the Galactic pirates. He notices several of the gruesome creatures along the bar are giving him a very unfriendly glare. Luke pats Threepio on the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Threepio and his stubby partner go outside and most of the creatures at the bar go back to their drinks. Ben is standing next to Chewbacca, an eight-foot-tall savage- looking creature resembling a huge grey bushbaby monkey with fierce baboon-like fangs. His large blue eyes dominate a fur- covered face and soften his otherwise awesome appearance. Over his matted, furry body he wears two chrome bandoliers, and little else. He is a two-hundred-year-old Wookiee and a sight to behold. Ben speaks to the Wookiee, pointing to Luke several times during his conversation and the huge creature suddenly lets out a horrifying laugh. Luke is more than a little bit disconcerted and pretends not to hear the conversation between Ben and the giant Wookiee. Luke is terrified but tries not to show it. He quietly sips his drink, looking over the crowd for a more sympathetic ear or whatever. A large, multiple-eyed Creature gives Luke a rough shove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hideous freak is obviously drunk. Luke tries to ignore the creature and turns back on his drink. A short, grubby Human and an even smaller rodent-like beast join the belligerent monstrosity.
direction.name: direction
